intro: Gentiana jarmilae, commonly known as the Jarmilae gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, which is characterized by its showy, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. The species is named in honor of the Czech botanist and physician Jarmil Ježek, who made significant contributions to the study of medicinal plants.
